intro: Arctotis tenuifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf arctotis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually blue or violet, with a yellow center, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Arctotis tenuifolia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
